intro: Rhytidostemma, commonly known as the peacock flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, South America, and Southeast Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, often colorful flowers that resemble peacock feathers, hence the common name. They typically have smooth, waxy leaves and produce milky sap. Rhytidostemma species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral displays.
